definition: skin cast off during molting/exuvia/to pupate/to molt/to slough/to cast off an old skin or shell
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion

sentences.english: When the uranium disintegrates, it changes into lead.
sentences.chinese: 当铀蜕变时，它变成了铅。

sentences.english: Some metamorphic relations (MR) are not good at detecting faults in metamorphic testing.
sentences.chinese: 蜕变测试时经常会出现蜕变关系检错能力低下的情况。

sentences.english: Some metamorphic relations (MR) are not good at detecting faults in metamorphic testing.
sentences.chinese: 蜕变测试时经常会出现蜕变关系检错能力低下的情况。

sentences.english: Three adjustments and three metamorphoses make capitalism the modern characters.
sentences.chinese: 三次调整，三次蜕变，资本主义具有了现代色彩。

sentences.english: The caterpillar will eventually metamorphose into a butterfly .
sentences.chinese: 毛毛虫最终将蜕变成一只蝴蝶。

sentences.english: As it sat there, it transformed into a dragonfly.
sentences.chinese: 当他坐上叶子时，他已蜕变成了一只成年蜻蜓。

sentences.english: The women have gone from being novelty racers to contenders.
sentences.chinese: 女孩们已经完成了从菜鸟车手到锦标争夺者的蜕变。

sentences.english: The form is changed by time, the moment outgrows you.
sentences.chinese: 形态随时间蜕变，那一瞬间盖过于你。

sentences.english: Food is apt to deteriorate in summer.
The tadpoles metamorphose and emerge onto land.
Beijing's remarkable metamorphosis is the clearest example of that.
sentences.chinese: 北京奇异的蜕变就是其最显而易见的例子之一。

sentences.english: After just a few years , she transformed from a tomboy into a little woman .
sentences.chinese: 才过了几年，她就由一个男人婆蜕变成了一个小女人。

sentences.english: Denominational disintegration is a tragic, but predictable, sight.
sentences.chinese: 宗派蜕变是一场悲剧，然而却可以预见。

sentences.english: DG undergoes a metamorphosis with each of his films.
sentences.chinese: 每完成一部电影，东健便完成一次蜕变。

sentences.english: Amy is enrolled by the university as graduate student. The metamorphosis finally succeeded.
sentences.chinese: 阿媚考上了，这种我看来的一种蜕变终于成功了。

definition: lit. to break through a cocoon and turn into a butterfly (idiom)/fig. to emerge strong after a period of struggle/to get to a better place after going through difficult period
to shed one's mortal body and exchange one's bones (idiom); born again Daoist/to turn over a new leaf/fig. to change wholly/to create from other material (story, artwork etc)
to rise from the ashes (idiom)/to thrive again after surviving an ordeal
to sharpen on grindstone/to improve oneself by practice
to sublimate/sublimation (physics)/to raise to a higher level/to refine/promotion
